title: Linux amixer Command with Practical Examples
description: Explore the amixer command, a powerful Linux utility for adjusting sound card mixer settings. Learn how to control master volume, manage specific sound channels, and apply practical examples to enhance your audio experience.

verify.name: Verify amixer command output
verify.hint: The verification script checks if the initial `amixer` command output shows the 'Master' volume at 100%, and if the subsequent `amixer set Master 50%` command sets the volume to 50%. If either of these checks fails, the verification will fail.

verify.name: Verify master volume adjustment
verify.hint: The verification script checks if the initial `amixer get Master` command shows the master volume at 100%, if the `amixer set Master 50%` command sets the volume to 50%, if the `amixer set Master 65536` command sets the volume to 100%, if the `amixer set Master mute` command mutes the volume, and if the `amixer set Master unmute` command unmutes the volume. If any of these checks fail, the verification will fail.

steps.title: Controlling Specific Sound Channels with amixer

verify.name: Verify sound channel control
verify.hint: The verification script checks if the `amixer scontrols` command lists the 'Headphone' channel, if the `amixer sset Headphone 50%` command sets the volume to 50%, if the `amixer sset Headphone mute` command mutes the channel, and if the `amixer sset Headphone unmute` command unmutes the channel. If any of these checks fail, the verification will fail.
